intro: Lepteranthus pectinatus, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
